thread.title: The Blue Jackets’ Twitter is spending its time trolling teams during the NHL All-Star Game
thread.title_full: The Blue Jackets’ Twitter is spending its time trolling teams during the NHL All-Star Game

author: Mary Clarke
title: The Blue Jackets’ Twitter is spending its time trolling teams during the NHL All-Star Game
text:
Troll game strong.
Twitter is one of the best parts of the NHL’s All-Star Weekend. The added commentary makes a sometimes lackluster weekend a treat, and the Blue Jackets are in full swing entertaining the masses by trolling fellow NHL team Twitter accounts. 
It started with some simple chirping. 
Stars. pic.twitter.com/eKTy3MMV6v 
— ColumbusBlueJackets (@BlueJacketsNHL) January 29, 2017 @BlueJacketsNHL *All-Stars
— Dallas Stars (@DallasStars) January 29, 2017 @DallasStars so predictable
— ColumbusBlueJackets (@BlueJacketsNHL) January 29, 2017 Doughty with a goal, too!

Can we hit 10 before the game ends? We're halfway there! #NHLAllStar 
— Anaheim Ducks (@AnaheimDucks) January 29, 2017 . @AnaheimDucks dunno, ten goals is a lot
— ColumbusBlueJackets (@BlueJacketsNHL) January 29, 2017 Then moved into some topical jokes, including going after the Capitals Twitter for their social media goof a few months ago.
OMG!! The #CapsAllStars ! #NHLAllStar @ovi8 @Holts170 pic.twitter.com/qVpfaMkAsg 
— Washington Capitals (@Capitals) January 29, 2017 . @Capitals Great faceswap 
— ColumbusBlueJackets (@BlueJacketsNHL) January 29, 2017 And of course, we can’t forget their 10-goal game against the Canadiens earlier this season.
imitation is the sincerest form of flattery pic.twitter.com/zSKXuHLPPo 
— ColumbusBlueJackets (@BlueJacketsNHL) January 29, 2017 Love you, Blue Jackets social media person.
